title: [Large-Scale] Language-Integrated Dynamic Learning Design for Entrepreneurship Development in Engineering Education: Strengthening Creative Expression and Professional Communication

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental knowledge and practical experience in engineering, basic project management, professional communication skills (technical writing, presentations), experience in technical writing, and proficiency in basic grammar and vocabulary usage
context.additional_context: Enhancing innovative problem-solving capabilities by combining entrepreneurial mindset and engineering knowledge for current practitioners. Focuses on improving idea communication through language-based communication skills (technical document writing, presentations, negotiations). Aims to comprehensively develop learners' reading comprehension (technical document analysis), expressive skills (idea visualization), and vocabulary (acquisition of specialized terminology).

learning_goals: Using design thinking processes and language analysis skills (text structure analysis, specialized vocabulary utilization), learners clearly express at least two creative solutions to engineering problems.

Through activity-based team projects, learners identify real-world industry problems, apply effective communication strategies (collaborative discussion, presentation skills), and concretize at least one business model.

Performing learning activities corresponding to Bloomâ€™s higher taxonomy levels (analysis, evaluation, creation), learners utilize critical thinking and specialized vocabulary (technical/business terms) to evaluate and refine technology-based startup ideas.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
